title: Beetle Identification
description: Discover the incredible diversity of beetles, the largest order of insects on Earth

questions.question: Approximately what fraction of all known insect species are beetles?
Which beetle is famous for rolling balls of animal dung and was sacred to the ancient Egyptians?
Which beetle from Africa is one of the heaviest insects in the world, weighing up to 3.5 ounces?
Which brightly colored beetle is considered a gardener's best friend because it eats aphids?
Which beetle produces light through a chemical reaction in its abdomen, creating a glowing display on summer nights?
Which large beetle has impressive mandibles resembling the antlers of a male deer?
Which beetle from South America is one of the longest insects in the world, including its horn, reaching up to 7 inches?
Which small beetle has devastated millions of acres of pine forests in North America by boring into tree bark?
Which invasive beetle with a metallic green body has killed hundreds of millions of ash trees in North America since its arrival from Asia?
Which iridescent beetle from Southeast Asia has wing cases so beautiful they were historically used in jewelry and textile decoration?
Which beetle defends itself by spraying a boiling-hot chemical mixture from its abdomen at predators?
Which beetle, considered a pest, has a distinctive copper and green metallic body and was accidentally introduced to the United States around 1916?
What is the hard, protective wing cover that distinguishes beetles from other insects called?
Which beetle can lift objects over 1,000 times its own body weight, making it one of the strongest animals relative to its size?
Which South American beetle holds the record for the longest beetle body (not including horns), reaching up to 6.5 inches?
